etymology.description: semantic 衤(衣) (yī, "clothing") + phonetic 血(血) (xiě, "blood") = expression of concern or compassion related to clothing -> original as 裇(裇), derived replacing radical of 恤(恤)
etymology.interpretation: 恤(恤) (xù, "compassion") is derived from 裇(裇), with 衤(衤) (yī, "clothing") representing the semantic element and 血(血) (xiě, "blood") serving as the phonetic component, emphasizing a compassionate response typically related to clothing or providing for the needy.

examples.chinese: 他体恤穷苦的人(他體恤窮苦的人)，总是不遗余力地帮助他们(總是不遺餘力地幫助他們)。
examples.pinyin: tā tǐ xù qióng kǔ de rén, zǒng shì bù yí yú lì de bāng zhù tā men.
examples.english: He shows compassion for the poor, always helping them tirelessly.

examples.chinese: 她体恤员工(她體恤員工)，努力改善他们的工作环境(努力改善他們的工作環境)。
examples.pinyin: tā tǐ xù yuán gōng, nǔ lì gǎi shàn tā men de gōng zuò huán jìng.
examples.english: She shows compassion for her employees and strives to improve their working environment.
